website_summaries.verdict: Buyers wanting a broom squeegee without paying Best of the Best prices will appreciate this affordable model.
pros: One of the best squeegee brooms for picking up pet hair
Handle is adjustable for extra length
Option to purchase in compact size
cons: A few owners claim the handle is low-quality aluminum and tends to crack over time

customer_reviews.title: The brush works but not the handle
customer_reviews.text: The brush is fairly effective at removing hair. As others have mentioned, the squeegee part does the removal work while the brush fluffs the rug up. However, the collapsible handle is made of beer-can grade aluminum and split at the joint after 10 minutes of use. I replaced it with a spare wooden handle.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I vacuumed yesterday afternoon, and was shocked by the amount of embedded pet hair that the broom removed. I used the straight edge, pulling it slowly towards me, to open up the carpet pile. Don't get discouraged if it doesn't seem to work right away. I stood at one place going over it for a bit, because my carpet is older, and matted down in high traffic areas. On the kitchen vinyl floor, the brush side trapped floating hair that usually escapes being swept up with a conventional broom. It also cleaned fur out of the dog bed quickly and easily. This thing is definitely a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: JR Shingleton

customer_reviews.title: FRIENDLY REMINDER
customer_reviews.text: Buy this product knowing you'll need a stronger stick. The broom itself is great. Stick broke after second use. 4 stars for the broom. 0 for stick quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nah

customer_reviews.title: Not the droids you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry I wasted my money on this item. It didn't work at all for me, well maybe a tiny bit with extreme effort but not anything a sane person would continue to do as a matter of practice...pfff. I have several diff rubber hand brushes that work great & I was doing the rug with the bottom of my sneaker but I wanted something more efficient/suitable for doing such a task, alas this was not it. I tried several times, as hard as I could, wetting the rubber & all, no joy.
customer_reviews.author: incognito

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, doesn't stay together
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this but it is so cheaply made that it wouldn't last long. You also spend more time screwing the head back in to the base then cleaning. The head was also much smaller then expected. I have new carpet in my home and was thinking my vacuum must not be working as well as I thought since everyone else's reviews show them getting tons of hair out but after doing my living room I didn't even have a handful of dog hair. Guess my shark vacuum and my neato are getting all of my gsd's hair up as they should!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: I own a boarding kennel and this is the only ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a boarding kennel and this is the only broom I use. Outstanding function. I don't even own a conventional broom and I house up to 40 dogs per night.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Doran

customer_reviews.title: Furtastic remover!
customer_reviews.text: This broom does what a vacuum can't! With some elbow grease, I saved money and electricity! Even my stair carpet looks groomed! I did short brush strokes and collected fur into small piles. I used my vacuum's tube to suck all the fur piles up so that it was less work for the vacuum. Pros: extends to a little over 5ft, retracts to about 3ft, length of brush is easy to control(not too long), has two sides (brush for carpet, squeegee side for flat surfaces), worth $18 Cons: needs elbow grease ;), brush head occasionally needs to be tightened (depends on how I use it)
customer_reviews.author: curveballamu

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with what I had read vs what the product really does.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this, and it was flimsy not to mention a lot of work getting the dog hair out of the small area rug. A small vacuum would work better with less effort and less time spent. The people that have tried it must have had a lot of time on their hands running the rubber tipped broom over and over again on rugs and carpets to get results. Mine came in damaged packaging, with nothing but the pole and broom hopelessly flopping around in the package. Amazon returned my money. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It let me down big time..
customer_reviews.text: I was soooo soo soooo disappointed in this. My family has thick hair.. I mean really think so we shed like crazy. I also have a dachshund who sheds just as bad. I was so excited to get this because I thought it was going to finally end my war with every vacuum I’ve ever owned but this did nothing but move hair around. For the most part I’m a skeptic but this dumb what we it is made me believe in it and it let me down so hard so quick that I was in disbelief. Whatever you do.. don’t believe the hype!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Goldner

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this amazing broom in today. I was excited to see if it was the answer to my dog/cat hair nitemare. IT IS!!!! It really does such a fantastic job. I have two dogs and three cats. I would have to sweep my ceramic and hard wood floors at least 3 times before I felt it was close enough to being clean. But this magical broom did it in one try. Best Amazon purchase I have ever made. Buy the broom. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jomojo

customer_reviews.title: I loved it, and bought a second one too.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any pets. My boyfriend actually got this to use on the carpet because of my hair & it works great with little effort at all. I bought one for my parents (they have pets) it was so easy and worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly E.

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Removes hair from carpet like a charm. It takes a little muscle because brooms and carpet don't really go together but it works just as described. I have extremely long hair and shed like crazy and that hair used to clog up my vacuum and get caught in the wheels so I was looking for something to help get up that excess hair before vacuuming. This works just as expected. I'm sure it would work for pet hair as well but I used it for my own!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We also brushed our dogs as a joke but they love it. Doing so also removes their fur better ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this broom is so satisfying. It collects a lot of fur out of the carpet and both the bristle side and squeegee side work really well. We also brushed our dogs as a joke but they love it. Doing so also removes their fur better than a dog brush usually does and they are getting rubs at the same time so it's a win win for everyone
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Flood

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Just Wow.
customer_reviews.text: Not gonna lie, bought this after reading a Buzzfeed post. No regrets now. I'm so in love with this broom thing. I've been steadily working my way around the house with it, in amazement at what it gets up. I even used it on our couch, some decorative pillows, and on the dog bed. The picture is of a large rug we vacuum daily with our Roomba, and every other day with our big vacuum, but that small area is where our Golden Retriever likes to sleep during the day. I'm just stunned at what this little rubber thingy can do.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grab hair. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Bought this to "rake the carpet" and get rid of hair before vacuuming. It doesn't grab hair well at all! In fact, it misses majority of the hair and the few hairs it does grab just fall off the next sweep over the floor you do. I have used a carpet rake that was like a plastic comb style and it grabbed ALL the hair... I got huge hairballs off the carpet before vacuuming using the plastic "comb" style carpet rake. This rubbery one is useless. Save your money and buy the plastic comb stye carpet rake. That one saves your vacuum from hair and really works.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica O

customer_reviews.title: Great Broom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this broom based on the tons of great reviews and I am not disappointed. I love this broom! It is lightweight but sturdy. I have used it on tile floors and carpet and it does a great job of getting the pet hair, lint, and dirt. I like this so much better than our traditional push broom. It is very easy to clean after use just using my hand, unlike our old broom. It also has a telescoping handle so that you can adjust it to whatever height you need. There is also a squeegee for doing the house windows and the car windows. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce V

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!!
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke almost immediately. It’s cheaply made, you have to apply pressure to get the pet hair to bunch up and this thing just can’t take it. I’m 4’10 and can barely open a jar of pickles so I wasn’t over doing it. You can adjust the height which is nice but is also it’s down fall because it’s constantly unscrewing itself. Good thing I’m short because I can use it while holding them together without it being seriously uncomfortable. It works I guess, but I recommend buying a more expensive one in hopes of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna P

customer_reviews.title: Newer model is significantly less efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Ok here’s the thing. The handle is going to break. Every single one we’ve ordered (I work at a dog daycare and boarding facility) is duct taped within 2 weeks but we can work with that. The bigger issue is that they remodeled the brush itself and it’s too big to fit underneath stuff now. The second issue with the newer model is that the rubber bristles themselves tend to hold on to the hair and redeposit the debris where you set it down next so you have to sweep the same section 3 or 4 times. If we could order the original model again we would keep ordering this product.
customer_reviews.author: sarah lewis

customer_reviews.title: A must have for pet owners or hair shedders
customer_reviews.text: The best $5/$6 I have every spent! This is a genius invention with a rubbery broom that catches everything! Today I didn't think the floor really needed to be swept, but the Furemover proved me wrong–I ended up with a big tumbleweed of dog hair and my hair and who knows what else? (See pic). The handle telescopes far longer than I need (I'm 5'8") but the telescoping comes in handy when sweeping under the couch or other out of the way places. This is a game changer if you have a lot of fur or hair in your home. You must try this, I am so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Frannie

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well, maybe Leaves BLACK MARKS
customer_reviews.text: Original: using on floor, bathtub, shower wall, baseboard, etc. For light color surfaces - it leaves BLACK MARKS that are like SKID MARKS and hard to come off. It works, but left with black mess. Our carpets are dark, as are our wood floors - and couldn't see the black on them, but I'm sure it there. With tile floors, could see black coming off in liquid... Update: I now know (from experimenting with different brooms) that the black liquid cleaning the tiles was due to the gross dirty grout getting cleaned! Does not appear to mark black on the tiles. However, it does leave black skid marks on the white plastic shower bottom/sides.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on Carpet Stairs!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for use on our stairs where the vacuum doesn’t seem to do a very good job of picking up dog hair. This gets everything. The only con is the handle is really short. I’m 5’2, so if it’s too short for me, a taller person will really not like having to hunch over so much to use it. I was expecting a broom handle length, so it’s my fault for not paying more attention to the dimensions before ordering. It works great, definitely recommend, just uncomfortable while using. I thought maybe it’s a telescoping handle but it appears not to be.
customer_reviews.author: Sgiv30306

customer_reviews.title: Zero understanding how this has such amazing reviews. First of all I'm 5'7" and I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Zero understanding how this has such amazing reviews. First of all I'm 5'7" and I'm hunched over trying to push this stupid thing. The rubber end is so flimsy that as soon as you apply pressure to it, it collapses and makes it impossible to run across the carpet. The very end of the handle keeps falling off. The height adjustment part of the pole keeps coming loose when you use it and gives way suddenly. Also the width of the rubber end must be made for a miniature room with limited square footage because it takes forever to get a standard sized room done with this. There has to be a similar product out there of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Yager

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sweeper as I'm constantly on the lookout for something that helps with dog hair. We have a 90lb white haired dog and dark wood floors - not a good combo! I bought this based upon all the five star reviews. I HATE it. It never worked. The head of it is rubber, so it doesn't move smoothly across the floor but the rubber "catches" along the way. It seemed to only stir up the hair, rather than grab it. I would have returned it, but once the stick of the broom was together, I couldn't get it apart to put it in the box. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great to rake up dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I just ran the Roomba on my wall-to-wall carpeted hallway (fairly low pile and thick carpet). The Roomba picks up tons of dog hair, so I wasn't expecting this broom to find much hair -- but it did! Like other reviewers recommended, I only tried the flat side. It takes some pressure and a bit of hard work, but it does indeed rake up a surprising amount of dog hair -- in my case 2 very large handfuls of it from a carpeted hallway in under 5 minutes. The carpet looked really good after raking it with this gizmo. This product exceeded my expectations. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Guy

customer_reviews.title: Broom does its job 100% (human hair on carpet) but handling isn't that great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have carpet and too much hair that my vacuums never suck up. This broom really does its job at basically brushing your carpet and accumulating all the hair into one giant clump. The only real bad thing I don't like about it is handling it. The stick is extendable but there isn't a hook that keeps it locked in place. So, basically imagine trying to simply pick it up to move it back in the storage closet or something and having it extend every time. You would either grab it from the lower half of the stick or just let it fully extend and tug on it back to the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that can help me get every bit of pet hair off of our carpet stairs (27)and hard floors. A vacuum sucks it up but still blows it around, and with a broom, it will just form tumbles of hair that gets stuck at the bottom of the broom and we always just see hair. This rubber broom is like a Miracle!!! It was a breeze to get the pet hair off of the carpet stairs, and it is easy to keep my hard floors clean by giving it a quick sweep!! Definitely 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars despite an issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for quickly and thoroughly removing dog hair from hardwood floors. It is the easiest way I have found to get the job done well in an easy and fast way. That alone makes this product 5 stars. The rug cleaning side takes a lot of elbow grease to work at all, and it doesn't do that great a job, IMHO. The first one I bought broke after a year, probably because you have to press hard to get the rug side to work. With my new one, plan to use only the squeegee side.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Not great, hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: Do you have to press down really hard to get anything out of the carpet. However, I have not gotten anything out of the carpet with it. When I press too hard, it disassembles. I have not used it on hard floors, a swiffer works for that for pet hair removal in hard surfaces. Vacuuming regularly is the best way to manage pet hair. For heavy shedders, daily vacuuming is a must. I use a pet carpet shampooer every three months to get the excess hair and Dander. The only reason I’m saying this is because I already have trouble using my arms, so this was a bust for me.
customer_reviews.author: C Writings

customer_reviews.title: Good on wood not so good on carpet
customer_reviews.text: OK so I was really looking forward to trying this because I have three dogs and two cats and I have hardwood floors as well as carpeting. I was hoping it would work the best on the carpeting however, it did not. I was going to return it but then I thought let me give it a shot on the hardwood floors and I like it very much on the hardwood floors getting up the dog hair. so as far as on the carpet it’s more of a chore on me than it effectively works but works really good on hardwood floors. As for the sturdiness I don’t know I’ve only had it three weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Saavy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: By far one of my best purchases from Amazon. As mentioned by others, I went back over my small area rug and couldn’t believe how much cat hair came up. The carpet was so much more vibrant. I have owned this broom for over six months and it is still in great shape. I am amazed how much hair and dust this picks up that you cannot see with naked eye. Also, the hair comes off the broom easily unlike standard brooms. It’s size makes it easy to get in corners and under beds, chairs and sofas.
customer_reviews.author: joyimp

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: its ok. Maybe I just have a breed of dog that is hopeless when it comes to fur removal. I have a mix breed..she has a double coat both long and short with undercoat. When I use the broom...yes lots and lots of hair come up..but not all of it, in fact a lot remain..but what it does pull up I can make a new dog out of. But maybe this time the vacume cleaner will last more than a year if I use the broom beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: How to get hay out of your carpet!
customer_reviews.text: I do wildlife rescue and I rescue baby cottontails. They eat hay, lots of it and no matter how I try I end up with hay all over the floor. I can't use a vacuum because it will scare the bunnies. This broom is fantastic! I quickly collects all the hay and whatever is on the rug and I can get it into a dustpan without scaring the bunnies and making a lot of noise. It doesn't clog like a vacuum and is so easy to clean. I love it. I now have one upstairs and downstairs to keep my rugs looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and rubber brush isn't stiff enough to make much of a difference
customer_reviews.text: The handle, as many have said, feels extremely cheap. I fully expect that I will need to replace it with a stronger wood handle or similar in the future. The big problem with it is that the rubber brush isn't stiff enough. It flops all over the place on my carpet. I have to rake in a very specific way or it does nothing. Even then, it takes a huge amount of time and effort to make any noticeable difference in the way the carpet looks and feels. So, it does work. But, don't expect miracles. And do expect a fair amount of effort. I wonder if the more expensive versions would have been worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmosrealm

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pick up my stray hairs that end up in the carpet throughout the day. My vacuum does not do a good job with this and I really don't want to buy a super expensive one. It did get some of the hairs from the carpet but it took a lot of work and a long time. I had to push/pull really hard and do super small sections at a time. I just got frustrated. It may work better for short pet hair but I wouldn't buy it for long hair on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: N Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: If I didn't already throw out the box, I'd have returned...
customer_reviews.text: For $14 it's not too bad - but I've seen similar issues to what other reviewers mentioned, not incredibly sturdy unless the handle is shortened all the way (about 1.5-2ft). It seems to work well on tiled bathroom floors to gather hair - but I haven't seen the results I was expecting with carpet. The other downfall is that it does not work with shorter hairs, from what I've seen, only long hair - and is somewhat ineffective in actually removing the hair off of the bristles. Take it with a grain of salt, the carpet in my townhome is longer than most - which could be the issue with gathering hair.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I WILL MAKE THIS PRODUCT WORK!!!  SOMEHOW!!! FOR SOMETHING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is a bit of a learning curve to this Furemover. It does not come with any instructions. Which is too bad. Instructions or tips might be useful. For my 2 cats with very fine fur it did not "sweep" up the fur as so much as it gathered or herded the fur into clumps. Which I still had to vacuum up. That said, I want this to work. I need this to work. I will MAKE IT WORK. I will find uses for this. The yellow telescopic handle works great. The rubber part looks like it will hold up well. There MUST be something this will do for me. It just looks too great to be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Knoch

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy assembly, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Item received promptly, packaged securely. Assembly was effortless. I did not experience any of the difficulties described by some reviewers with the extension pole that inserted into the base easily and securely and extended without difficulty. I tried the item on many types of rugs and carpets after vacuuming and on upholstered couches. I have two long-haired dogs. No hair was produced so I did not need this item. It is effective on wood and stone floors and on bare floors under furniture. This is a quality product. I recommend it for anyone who does not have a high efficiency vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Zbar

customer_reviews.title: Best for throw rugs!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this broom for my wood floors cause I haven't been able to find a broom soft enough. However, although you can use it on the wood floor, and it does pick up the pet hair, you can't get in the corners good, so you still have to use a regular broom or something to get the corners. That said, what it IS great for, is the throw rugs. It pulls the hair, etc. off of them real good. I will use it for that. So if you want it to sweep your wood floors, I wouldn't recommend it. But if you want something to clean your throw rugs, I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mvale

customer_reviews.title: Magic stick
customer_reviews.text: Do you have hair? Do you have pets that have hair? Have your broken 3 vacuum cleaners trying to clean up that hair? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then you NEED the FURemover Broom. I unboxed it, used it on my stairs and was amazed/appalled at the amount of hair that I got out of the carpet. I have a hound that likes to sleep on the couch, and a few quick strokes of the broom picked up a whole dog worth of hair. Whether it’s flawless product design, science, or witchcraft, I’m hooked and will never clean without this again. Thanks FURemover for helping me out of this hairy situation.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: I did NOT know what was in my carpets til I got this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Between me, my girlfriend, our cat, and our two dogs, the carpet in our apartment was always clogging up our vacuum cleaner. We'd literally have to stop halfway through vacuuming with a pair of scissors to cut away hair that had wrapped around the roller brush. I was looking through Buzzfeed and saw this thing and was like, WOAH I need it! After using it one time, I brought up a pile of hair the size of a football! Until the day we moved, I used this thing every time I planned to vacuum, and it made it so much easier to get through a cleaning day. Definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Magesdoitbest

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the same reason another person did... I noticed that I could pull up shedded fur with my rubber flip flops on the short pile carpet, so I thought I would see if there was such a thing as a rubber broom. Got it today, and WOW... I swept up a bunny's worth of floof in just a small area of floor (I have four house rabbits) You need to sweep quite firmly, but I was absolutely amazed at the amount of fur that came up. Haven't tried it on the wooden floors yet but I really wanted it for the carpet, as two of my bunnies are absolutely petrified of the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Juliebun

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: When sweeping up dog hair using a regular broom you just seem to push the hair around and it gets everywhere and often doesn't get all the hair. This one traps the hair and doesn't fling it around while your sweeping. I find myself sweeping more often because its just so much more easier. I also bought a broom with the long handled dust pan for sweeping up the piles so I don't have to bend down to pick it off the floor which makes a diference for me. (hoping to get the electric vacuum dustpan thingy) The one that sits stationary and sucks up the dust when it senses motion.
customer_reviews.author: feefee

customer_reviews.title: WOW! It works!
customer_reviews.text: The last thing I want to do is show a photo of my nasty carpet BUT HOLY HELL this thing works! I used this on every carpet in my house so far and was in shock at how much hair/pet hair was there and I couldn’t see. The smooth side works too on floors and I found it was a little easier on the fabric couch than the bristled side. Love that it expands longer so I’m not on my knees! And i’m not constantly cutting hair out of the vacuum now. Give this a try you won’t be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: It works amazing but it breaks easy
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I really like this item. It gets up all of the hair on hardwood, tile, and my rugs. The only issue I have is that it breaks easily. I have bought 3 of them already. I’m about to buy my fourth!! I have had a regular broom for years with no issue. I think it’s because this broom expands. Maybe it would be worth removing that feature to make it more sturdy?? Either way I’m buying another one because it is a staple in a pet owner’s home
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Cool broom, terrible handle
customer_reviews.text: I like to watch YouTube of people cleaning carpets or powerwashing decks. This fits the bill when you mindlessly drag the broom and pull up ridiculous amounts of pet hair. The actual broom handle is terrible and it wouldn't stay locked and ended up splitting while I was using it. I put it on a regular broom handle and was able to use the broom. I use it on hardwood floors and I am disgusted every time I use it. I like it better than using a broom as the hair sticks to the head versus flying around in the air. My only complaint is the manufacturer should sell the broom head or make a better handle.
customer_reviews.author: magnolia127

customer_reviews.title: Pet lovers:  Move over brooms, now there’s something meatier!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this almost on a whim, on or about Prime Day. Would definitely order again, even at full price. Two pet-owning friends bought one after seeing mine in action. Some examples of where this is better than other options: - sofa: for removing pet hair, worked better than two types of sponges designed specifically for pet hair removal. Also quicker and easier (and more environmentally friendly) than using lint rollers which was previously the best option for removing pet hair. - tile and hard wood floors: I get up so much pet hair using this AFTER sweeping, I finally just skipped the sweeping step. - the squeegee was an added bonus that worked better-than-expected in cleaning up spills
customer_reviews.author: Kate P

customer_reviews.title: I Had One of These Before
customer_reviews.text: Does it really pick up hair/fur? I have hardwood, carpeting, and area rugs. Not impressed as far as picking up any kind of fur on the wood or carpeting. My area rugs are just too dense for this thing to make a dent in the cat fur, so I can't say it does well in that area. What I DO use this for is to sweep away water in my backyard after washing down our long porch. I use the Squeegee side and for THIS purpose, it's absolutely awesome and the concrete dries quickly. So if you need this broom for something like I use it for, I highly recommend, but not so much to remove fur or hair.
customer_reviews.author: BlackHeartNY

customer_reviews.title: Great product except the cheap handle
customer_reviews.text: The broom works well on a variety of surfaces (wood, vinyl, carpet, concrete) and also does well with wet and dry sweeping. It’s great for getting dog hair from carpet, which was my main reason for purchase. My complaint like many other reviewers is that the telescopic handle is poor quality. Mine loosens and collapses while I use it and I can see that if I tighten it more it’ll just break. If this broom had a quality handle it would be 5 stars. I don’t understand why the manufacturers didn’t just charge $2 more and have a quality handle.
customer_reviews.author: D&DBR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: So of course I saw this product on TikTok...and added it to the list of things that TikTok made me buy:) but.....I'm very glad that I did. I have a Siberian husky who sheds ALOT...and in all seasons. I use this on my carpet before vacuuming and it loosens up the hair so easily that my vacuum never got. I never realized I had that much dog hair caked into my carpet until I used this!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Frey

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned the dog beds crazy good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on the dog beds before I vacuumed. I usually just vacuum the beds, but, after reading the reviews, I decided it was worth it to try. (AKA My dogs are super hairy.) It would have almost been embarrassing if anyone saw the amount of hair that came off the beds. I will say, it didn’t really work on my area rug, but I think it’s because it’s easier to vacuum than the beds. Also, I didn’t find it any easier on the hardwood floor than a vacuum. But. Totally worth the cost for just the beds.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: Holy Smokes! It works!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product on one of those Buzzfeed "20 products you never knew you needed." Omg. I knew I needed it I just didn't know it existed! Not going to lie, took a lot more elbow grease than expected, but that's just me being lazy. I also don't recommend using is the house is 88 degrees. Works up a sweat. Never mind all that - I used the product on a cheap thin carpet from Big Lots that no matter how many times I Dyson, I can't get my dog's white hair off it. Well...I got it off! It works it really works! You'll be grossed out how much pet hair was in the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah P

customer_reviews.title: It does not work...
customer_reviews.text: I got mine on the 19th. I'm very disappointed in the quality of the item. It did not do anything it was supposed to do. It has zero stamina in the bristles. Nothing the give the bristles resistance to pull together the dirt or hair from the floor. You put it on the floor and the bristles just go flat. I am returning the item. I must have got a defective one. It didn't even work like a regular broom would. I normally don't give reviews but this one really disappointed me. I had high hopes for this product. I hope my next choice works out better.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie C.

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness finally a broom that works!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought it! The bristles are the correct elasticity to pick up all the short 'min-pin' hairs and dust that even microfiber left behind, squeegee/ bristle combo is very useful and works super well on cowskin rug and microfiber sofa & rinses off with plain water; we live near the beach so hopefully the metal handle resists rust because it telescopes just right and doesn't collapse on itself like the plastic ones- only wish it was a little wider so I could cover more area fast- otherwise no complaints! BTW used it on laminate, lux vinyl plank, ceramic tile, cowhide and wool rug surfaces- good to go on all.
customer_reviews.author: Ecbatana

customer_reviews.title: Effective with Elbow Grease ;)
customer_reviews.text: This product deifinitely works. Im giving it a 4/5 inly because it does require you to put your back into it when scraping the hair. The flat side is more effective as other reviews state, but overall the hair is mostly gone. I use this in my own bedroom given im a long haired hispanic female with crazy thick hair that decides it wants to fall out like crazy randomly. The picture may suggest im gross but i used to clean the hairs with a short broom hands and knees before soo this is a great improvement. I hope it lasts me a long while because it is effective
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Castro

customer_reviews.title: Just.... Wow
customer_reviews.text: I would love to write a review on the quality of this broom, but unfortunately I took it out of the box and it immediately broke. I tried pull-sweeping and SNAP! The end came off the pole and I'm going to have to jerry-rig some way to fix it as I didn't want to go through the work of returning it. I hope someday when I dig this worthless thing out of the closet and fix it that it serves its purpose, but I expect things to work when they're brand new. I recommend paying a little more for another similar product that will actually hold together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful broom for pet hair, but the handle sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Only three stars because of the retractable handle that will not stay in place. The broom itself does clean up the hair, and it is wonderful. However, the broom handle collapses and expands. When expanding the broom it does not lock into place, and everytime I use it, it collapses. No matter how many times I adjusted it. Not to mention, I am 5'7" and the broom handle is too small. I replaced the handle with a broom handle from the dollar tree and it works great. The retractable handle went in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Bailey

customer_reviews.title: REPURPOSED Dog hair bad. Snow GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I started the return process because it did nothing for dog hair. We have 3 short hair dogs and hair was visibly left behind when we tried it. BUT...we live in snow country and it is great for cleaning snow off of cars, hot tub lids and that final scrape to get the last snow chunks off the deck. It does not scratch the car surface and snow comes off in sheets. Best tool for snow country if you like your cars snow free and scratclrss.
customer_reviews.author: terbear

customer_reviews.title: I’d rate it a 100 out of 5 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: This broom is amazing!!! We have three dogs with long hair. I vacuum all the time and there’s still this layer of hair on the carpet that I can’t get rid of and tumble weeds of dog hair and dog hair along the base boards! It was insanity! Every other time I vacc I have to clean the underside of the vacuum bc the hair tangled in the bristles. We were looking into buying a 300 dollar vacuum specifically for pet hair bc we just couldn’t stand it anymore. But I tried this broom and voila - all the dog hair is gone! It looks like new carpet! I’m obsessed!! Do yourself a favor and buy this
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Wood

customer_reviews.title: This thing is as great as everyone says it is!
customer_reviews.text: This thing really is as good as everyone says it is. We have 2 dogs and 3 cats... so fur is most definitely a constant battle. Our living room has a relatively high pile rug and this thing makes quick work of getting out the embedded furs (especially those little short ones - we have a pitbull). It's also great at making quick work of the fur on the couch, the bed, everything really. It's also great at quick touch ups on the hardwoods. The bonus is the telescoping handle. I wish all my mops, brooms, etc had these handles.
customer_reviews.author: blackntanmomma

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes me happy, happy. We recently got a black lab and the amount of shedding is crazy!!! This is fast and easy to use. I know floors are getting clean because I can see the collection of fur it is gathering...it’s not just scattering it around like a normal broom. I hate sweeping and pulling fur/gross stuff out of the broom, no need to do that with this. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use instant satisfaction!
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived, I decided to try on my carpet prior to vacuuming. Wow did it get up the fur! I had to put down my beloved boxer in January but his white little fur was imbedded in the carpet and topped with my Maine Coon cat fur and now German Shepherd. All the fur in my carpet was lifted and I could pick up by hand and vacuum the rest. I felt guilty about getting all of my white boxers fur out but this product is amazing! Oh I do have a Dyson Animal vacuum which is great but doesn’t pick up imbedded fur that great.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Miller

customer_reviews.title: Created a Microfiber cloth mop with this broom. It’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this broom to mimic what a cleaning lady did at my house when my high shine floors were impossible to clean... I took a microfiber and cut a hole in the center and dropped it down the pole of this broom. Letting it fold over the bristles. Because it’s rubbery, it flexes which is exactly what I needed! I mop with the microfiber folded over the end and then I can flip it over and use both sides! It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Full-Time Amazon-er

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2016 -- still amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2016 and it is still my favorite cleaning item I've ever ordered online. I have 5 pets, this is AMAZING for pet hair and you can use it on rugs and carpets too. It takes more effort on a rug or carpet, but it will work. Sweeps up more hair, dirt, etc. better than any other broom and wow it's lasted so much longer than any broom I've ever ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: had to return the compact one and get the regular size
customer_reviews.text: I could not get all the pieces of the compact handle to screw in. The item did not come with instructions but it seemed like it should be simple to assemble, yet it did not work. I returned the compact one and bought the big yellow one instead. While I don't like the color of the yellow handle (which is the whole reason I bought the compact one in the first place) it was easy to assemble and the rubber broom head does do a better job of picking up pet hair on my wood floors than a typical broom does.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: I’d put 1 in Everyroom /all hardwood floors1is an absolute Must you’ll see
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t find suction power I did find it ran evenly across the floor so if that’s what you mean by suction then it was great every room should on one of these devices I hate hair length little bugs N it’s all collected on the squeegee part an wiped off easily , so kno if people had phobias like I do they have no idea the hair and long that accumulates whoever invented this did a great job thank you so much it’s made life easier for me quicker and much healthier for my mental state of mind no joke!!!
customer_reviews.author: GBYME

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately doesnt work for my rug
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my rug in my living room. I was very excited to see how it worked since I have a golden retriever and even with vacuuming 3 times per day the rug still is covered in hair. And I saw all the super cool reviews of piles of hair. This doesnt work on my rug at all lol I cant move it when I push the broom at all even with tiny strokes it just bends the broom, and pulling it towards me or the squeegee side does nothing. The rug has pretty long pile which I'm assuming is why it doesnt work. I'll keep it anyways in case some day I get a different rug.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Pet Fur -- and Fir Needles!
customer_reviews.text: One golden retriever, one long-haired cat and one short-haired cat. I bought a Furminator yeeears ago when they first came out and cost fifty dollars, and I've been using that ever since to "pre-clean" the floors before vacuuming. The Furminator requires being on hands and knees; this doesn't. I would still use the Furminator for rugs or carpets that have a weird, grippy nap in some cases, but this is pretty great. It not only gets the pet hair but things like Christmas-tree needles which the Furminator is not as great at. Between the brush, the broom, and a special pet-hair vacuum, our floors look largely respectable, usually.
customer_reviews.author: vifargent

customer_reviews.title: In LOVE!! Makes my area rugs fluff!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this broom/brush! Works well on hardwood and tile floors, and carpets and area rugs. The amount of hair, esp dog hair, it picks up is ahhhhmazinggg!! My area rugs look flufffy, like they've just been washed. I found it to be most effective if you use short strokes as opposed to long ones (I use the bristle side). This is also great to use on carpeted stairs as it is so much more easier to just grab the FURremover as opposed to pulling out the vaccum cleaner, plugging it in, attaching the right handle, etc. I love this so much, I purchased two!!
customer_reviews.author: NiBiJo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing pet hair broom!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Just received the Evriholder pet hair removal broom. I have never been so excited to clean my area rug! I just vacuumed the high pile rug with my Dyson Animal vac when the mailman delivered this broom. I tore open the box and put it together in less than a minute. Figured there wouldn’t be any dog hair since I just vacuumed the rug not even 10 minutes before. Boy! Was I wrong! I still can’t believe what it picked up and it fluffed up the rug as well! My area rug looks brand new! I think this broom is going to eliminate the use of the super heavy Dyson! Thank you for selling such an amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have cats that shed, my daughter and I also shed it seems. This works great to pick hair up, it doesn't clog the brush, it rolls right off and just piles up. It also works dirt up, seeing as I occasionally get cat litter on the carpet and the vacuum doesn't pull it up out of the fibers, the "rake" pops it back to the top. I vacuum as soon as I am done raking and my carpet gets cleaner than ever and no more hair wrapped around the brushes. It's a blessing to not have to clean the brushes anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this! This was another “TikTok made me buy it” and although we don’t have a lot of hardwood, I was curious if it would work on carpet. The brush side doesn’t do much, but the flat edge is AMAZING!!! I vacuum regularly and have a roomba thaf does a daily go-over, so I was shocked at how much hair this scraped up. I did my whole living room floor in a half hour. My dog is short haired and doesn’t shed much so I was surprised at what all I gathered up! I love this thing! My carpet looks brand new and fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. It’s amazing to see what dog hair our expensive vacuum just can’t pick up by itself. I’ll use this broom to get up 95% of the hair out of the carpet and then vacuum over what I just swept. Definitely cuts down on the work of the vacuum and way easier to pick up than cleaning the vacuum brushes out all the time. I’ll also use it on the tile floors and pile up the hair/dust before sweeping. Anyone who uses a broom knows that the dog hair gets tangled in the broom bristles and flys around everywhere. This rubber broom holds on to it and pushes it to making piles easier. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS !! BUT BEWARE OF THE NaStyineSS it brings up
customer_reviews.text: GAME CHANGER for those who have carpets. I was disgusted by how much hair was in my carpet. Now i do this every couple months and have seen a change in my allergies. Sadly I put a lot of pressure on this so the top part comes off which sucks. I think it's just glued so my hand slips and takes it off. I hope they make a bigger / taller one for easier clean-up. I'm 5'2 and this is still a bit short for me. A longer handle would give better control.
customer_reviews.author: Annmoreclothes

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I had something similar to this years ago and absolutely loved it. This one is even better! Three cats, one dog, and two men in and out of the house with snow, ice, mud and occasionally dog stuff, you can just imagine my entry. Now I’m able to sweep and squeegee the same area as needed. The pole is adjustable to my vertically challenged height, so if someone else has even tried to use it, I would know! I can spray my walls and then just squeegee them clean. So much faster and easier. Absolutely love it. Cats are fascinated with it and chase it and pounce on it when I stop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with hard, smooth and flat surfaces the best
customer_reviews.text: It does what the video shows you, however, it works best on flat surfaces like hardwood, laminate, concrete floors. Does not work very well with regards to getting fur out of carpet or textured surfaces. I tried using it on my rugs, cat towers, and doormat and it did not provide any fur or debris removal. Squeegee side works really well with regards to cleaning up wet debris on hard surfaces, cleaning windows, and general sweeping into a dustpan. Handle snapped down on me twice while in the Locking position, so be careful of that.
customer_reviews.author: CS Coffing

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to be excited for this broom. It is just meh. It is a definite work out sweeping hair up on carpet. I felt like I was constantly chasing hair that I swept, but it carried right back to another spot. It was not easy to use at all, well, except on the hardwood floors. Carpet, not so much. Maybe there needs to.be more bristles and closer together. I also found the head wanting to twist off. I had to keep tightening it. This will work in a pinch, but I am not pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great for homes with dogs
customer_reviews.text: I really like this "broom" as it is light, easily gets under furniture, and is able to sweep into a pile hair and hair balls, along with rope strands from dog toys. I use it mostly on our tile floors, but it also works fairly well on carpets. You do have to pick up the piles or vacuum them, but it is much easier than carrying the vacuum all over the house and is especially good for a quick touch up. So far I have had no problems with the handle that others mentioned. Would definitely recommend. Oh, and it is also useful for retrieving dog toys that have disappeared under furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Makes sweeping fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t remember how I even came across this item! It works!! One of those things we didn’t know we needed!!! Have two golden retrievers and all hardwood floors and the furry dust bunnies are relentless. We’ve been swiffering for years and years and thought things were fine. This rubber-broom thing is sorta fun to use. It pushes the fur into impressive large piles. Fur and dust does not stick to the head, so a vac or dustpan is needed to pick up dust that gets gathered. The narrow profile of the broom head is agile and gets into tight spots. I am debating getting a second for upstairs. I’d recommend this broom!!
customer_reviews.author: MW White

customer_reviews.title: fur-ball tumbleweeds good bye
customer_reviews.text: Well let’s just say I kinda brag on this product. There is nothing more defeating than when you sweep your house 🏡 and when you think you’re done you find all these small evil pieces of dog hair & cat hair sprinkled throughout your “clean” floor. This product gets all those non fur-ball tumbleweeds gone. I keep thinking if I am able it make the hair disappear my husband who said no cats or dogs won’t notice the 3 dogs - Saint Bernard-Ms Patronus, bassador-Charlie and weeny house elf do- Dobby or the 3 cats Professor Snape, Minerva McGonagall & Alchemy!! 😂 Thanks for magically making my house seem pet less when it’s a zoo!
customer_reviews.author: Katy’s iPhone7 app

customer_reviews.title: I'd use this over a broom to sweep up pet hair any day of the week!
customer_reviews.text: This was seriously love at first sight. We have hardwood floors and no matter how many times we sweep, a lot of individual dog hair would stick/float around. This squeegee solved that problem and has managed to keep everything in a tight string of hair. I knocked a star because I would love for the squeegee to have a tad bit more length but it certainly isn't a deal breaker. I'd use this over a broom to sweep up pet hair any day of the week!
customer_reviews.author: HufflePuffle

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: While it appears well constructed, and I like the telescoping handle, I wasn't able to get much use out of it for my intended purpose of getting fur out of rugs and carpets. As far as hardwood and tile floors it works all right but no better than an ordinary broom. However, I'm giving it 3 stars because it does do a very good job of reaching/washing some high windows, and the squeegee part works well too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: New favorite cleaning tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this broom! Oh my God, the amount of dog hair that I had no idea I had in every nook and cranny of my house! 😫 But this handy tool got it all for me with much sweat and hard work! It was all worth it though because I feel like my house is cleaner! I swept the floors and furniture with this thing and it did an awesome job! I will definitely be making this a weekly chore! If not more often! With a Golden Retriever in the house ya never know! This was able to get the fur that my weekly vacuuming was missing!
customer_reviews.author: HiFrancis!

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and effort
customer_reviews.text: I was really expecting more from this duo. I have a corgi and she sheds like crazy. The brush I used on the couch doesn’t even pick up the hair like described. The hair just stayed in place. The floor tool is awkward because the hair doesn’t stick to it so you have to get out a broom and dustpan to get the hair pile off the floor. Might as well use a broom to begin with. Did it work, slightly. It took too much effort. Don’t bother, better products on the market. Like a broom!
customer_reviews.author: Tmc913

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Okay this broom is a game changer for pet hair. We got a dog three weeks ago and the shedding is pretty extreme as he is a Great Pyrenees. My old roommates had a flat broom they used for their dog and I was on Amazon looking for a similar one when I stumbled across this. I was skeptical, but it is SO worth it. Even when we took it out of the box and put it together I was worried about the size being too small. It works on hard wood floors and carpet, and the best part is that the dogs fur really doesn't get stuck in the bristles!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: I don't write reviews, but this needs one!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to clean up lab puppy hair, on my main area rug as it's advertised for rugs. This thing is amazing. We love how it cleans without stirring up the dust and dirt. Four long haired, one bearded, one fur baby, plus loads of cooking in this house... And this rubber broom picks it all up. We use it in the garage to clean the floor, or squeegee any wet spills. I'm buying one for my friends birthday who has three rescue pups. My new daily use cleaning tool. Bye bye regular bristle broom.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley LL

customer_reviews.title: The product I didn’t know I needed
customer_reviews.text: I went through the pictures uploaded with reviews and decided to purchase based on the experience of others. I have a long hairs cat and a stubborn carpet. My pet friendly vacuums don’t seem to live up to their promises. I used this on my bedroom floor and was amazed by how much pet hair I cleaned up. I could feel a difference in the carpets texture. If I could improve on the product I would add a longer handle. I’m y’all and the bending can be tough on my back. Especially since you do need to put a little elbow into the process. Other than that, it’s a sturdy little life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: If you have hardwood floors and pets, get this!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so great! We have a smaller one we have used on our couches for years for getting off pet hair. Wish I had purchased this sooner! It definitely gets up the hair and dirt. Does a great job on our rugs too, even after I have vacuumed. This really grabs the hair. Doesn’t work as great on shag rugs, but that’s to be expected. On the hardwood floors and on our flat carpets it is fantastic. I use this almost every day thanks to our two fur babies, two kiddos and husband.
customer_reviews.author: Cench624

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality extendable broom handle
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product 3 stars because the bonus product is an awesome bonus. The rubber broom head and the rubber hand brush are fantastic. The broom handle is trash. I took a gamble with this purchase because the reviews weren't fantastic but still purchased based on cost and lint brush bonus gift. As soon as I extended the broom stick and locked it into place I could feel the poor quality. For a few weeks when I'd swept I'd have to keep readjusting the lock and today it just came apart. One of the internal plastic pieces snapped and now its broken. I duct taped it. Will end up getting a new stick for it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This saved my rugs! I have a 200 lb black dog that sheds a ton, even with daily brushing. When this arrived today my husband asked "why do you need a rubber broom?!?" After going over our large wool rug, while he watched, suddenly he said "ohhhhh, that's why you need a rubber broom." Now he wants one for his garage workshop, lol! The hand brush cleans up piles after sweeping, without leaving the dust line! I love that it is so easy to wash after use, so I can have it clean and ready to use anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on a hardwood floor
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work on my kilim rug. But works quite good on a hardwood floor. You have to attach the head properly because it sometimes comes off. I wish it indicated its front/back clearer so that I know the correct way to use this.
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have LOTS of hair
customer_reviews.text: We have two indoor cats with short hair. I was excited to try this broom to get our carpets cleaner, but after the initial use I haven't seen much of a difference. On first use, I got more of the fur up and I think the carpets might have been a little fluffier (however this might be wishful thinking). Weekly usage is not turning up a lot, but this might be more of a spring cleaning type device. I think with more animals this might be more of a weekly thing, but for us this might not get as much use as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Not for carpet that’s regularly vacuumed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this two days ago, it arrived today and my boyfriend used it all over my apartment. I regularly vacuum 2 times a week or more and the only place it collected a good amount of hair was from under my bed where my vacuum couldn’t reach. Other then that it picked up nothing. If you regularly vacuum and still got a lot of hair and stuff then I would probably just buy a better vacuum. I have a Hoover pet and apparently it’s working pretty good. The carpet rake works well but I will be returning due to I don’t need this tool.
customer_reviews.author: AShhh

customer_reviews.title: Woah this gets all the tough fur!!!
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of 2 dogs and 2 cats that shed A LOT my house is covered in fur all the time. I’ve invested in many vacuums and other tools to help control the fluff and this is now one of my favorites. I’ve always felt vacuums only do a so so job of picking up fur in the carpets and long fur just wraps itself around the brushes and makes it less effective, so it’s been a constant battle. I was blown away at how much fur this scraped off my area rugs (both low and high pile). Needless to say I’m in love!
customer_reviews.author: ermiba

customer_reviews.title: This broom is amazing. We have too many pets and too much ...
customer_reviews.text: This broom is amazing. We have too many pets and too much hair everywhere.. Its one of those situations where you vacuum and 5 minutes later there is a tumbleweed of hair flying around. We have other brooms and when you sweep literally the hair just goes flying or worse gets all tangled up in the broom. This broom literally sweeps up the hair with no issues, I can sweep the whole house in half the time it takes the vacuum. Also it doesn't miss anything, even dirt, dust, etc gets swept up. We also have the eyevac home ( And when combined with this vacuum it makes pet hair so much easier to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Great Pyrenees and a Siberian Husky, so fur happens. This has been a game changer in keeping the hair under control in between deep vacuuming. We use a shop vac because dog hair drives me batty, but I love our dogs and they're part of the family. So, we found what works. I was concerned about the handle from reading other reviews, but thus far we haven't had a single issue with it. Glad I took a chance and bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, for SMALL areas
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use this broom on a carpet. I think it's a little too small for that. When used on our fabric bench, it's better than a lint roller! It got a lot of animal hair up, but you have to really work for it. It takes muscles to get all the hair up. The telescopic feature doesn't lock well. I would not use this size broom with the telescopic portion fully extended, you'll definitely break it while using the aforementioned muscle to get it to really work. All in all, I wish it were sturdier & bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this it assist in getting cat hair out of carpet, and while it works, it doesn’t work AS WELL as I had hoped. The brush head also won’t stay on the included pole...and I’d honestly not mind if it got a little deeper into the carpet. The “bristles” just are sturdy enough to penetrate my medium pile carpet to get out deeply imbedded fur. It does get for surface stuff up, but it wasn’t the miracle I was hoping for. I bought it expecting to work up a sweat, and I’ve tried to really “dig in” to the carpet...but even with all my elbow grease...it’s just meh.
customer_reviews.author: JJDJD

customer_reviews.title: best broom ive every used
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING for dog hair. We have two larger dogs that shed something awful. This is the best broom I have every used, and I'm not saying that just for the review. It's hands down amazing. I have recommended it to many people. Regular brooms fling dog hair everywhere and you just spend half the day chasing dog hair with the broom. This broom does NOT fling dog hair. It puts all the dog hair in a neat little pile. I have even used it on carpet and its amazing the hair that came up even after just vacuuming. I never knew I could talk so much about a broom! Go buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT on hardwood!
customer_reviews.text: It says this is good on carpets but it did absolutely nothing for my low pile carpet. I started a return & then decided to try it on my hardwood floors. It was EXCELLENT on the hardwood & was better than anything else I've ever tried. Not only did it quickly capture all the dog & cat fur flying/lying around -- it immediately released it, unlike brooms that won't let go so that I can dispose of the fur! I immediately cancelled my return. I have a great metal rake for my carpets that doesn't work on hardwood. Now I have an excellent tool for each & I'm fur free at last!
customer_reviews.author: E. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews before buying this product. I was still skeptical until I used it myself. I have a multiple cat household and need to clean floors daily. This broom is great! It has two sides, one looks like a fine rake the other side is smooth. I also used it on furniture and the cat hair thoroughly came up. I can clean without using my vacuum cleaner. Honestly, I have an expensive Dyson and this broom cleans the cat hair up better than the expensive vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: FURemover Broom, Pet Hair Removal Broom with Squeegee & Telescoping Handle That Extends from 3 - 5', Black & Yellow
product_meta.description:
Style:Broom

The innovative and unique multi-purpose FURemover Broom can be used indoors or outdoors to remove cat hair, dog fur, and dirt from practically any surface including hardwood floors, tile, carpet, rugs, linoleum, concrete, and upholstery. The soft head is made of natural rubber that acts like a pet hair magnet and won't scratch hardwood floors.

For carpet fur removal, pull the broom in short, sharp strokes to bring embedded hair to the surface of the carpet. Even expensive vacuums made specifically for pet hair can't compete with the FURemover Broom's ability to pick up embedded pet hair. 

Flip it over and use the all-purpose rubber squeegee side to pick up dirt and dust on hardwood floors. It cleans up spills with ease. The natural rubber of the squeegee blade prevents water spots even on glass, which is great for wiping windows, glass shower doors, and car windshields.
